image.altText: Dark green leaves in foreground focus, with blurred outline of a olive-tanned woman in the background, green singlet, brown hair

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's family and domestic violence sector is at a "crisis point" with one service turning away up to 200 women every month, including those assessed as being at "serious risk" of harm or death.

title.children: Hundreds of women turned away from shelter in territory's DV crisis

image.altText: The community as seen from the air on the shores of Lake Evella.

props.synopsis: A man has died after a helicopter he was travelling in collided with a bird, during a flight over the Northern Territory's remote north-east Arnhem Land.

title.children: Bird fatally strikes a helicopter passenger in remote NT

image.altText: A group of people leave a courthouse. A man and a woman holding hands are at the front of the group.

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory police officer is suing the government for malicious prosecution after it took a Supreme Court jury less than an hour to acquit him of two counts of rape.

title.children: Police officer sues after being acquitted of rape by a jury in less than an hour

image.altText: a wall covered in aboriginal street art

props.synopsis: The NT coroner this week handed down her findings into the death of Kumanjayi Walker, almost six years after he was fatally shot in Yuendumu.

title.children: Six years after Kumanjayi Walker's shooting, a reckoning within NT police is inescapable

image.altText: A brain on a tray in a lab.

props.synopsis: Australian scientists find the first evidence of an unusual pattern of brain scarring only seen in people repeatedly exposed to blast waves.

title.children: Brain injury of Australian soldier matches that of dead US Navy SEALS

image.altText: Two men, three women and a girl all smile as they stand near a building on a country property.

props.synopsis: A powerful language teaching method from the US is being trialled in Central Australia, offering new hope for languages on the brink of extinction.

title.children: Native American teachers join push to save at-risk Indigenous languages

image.altText: Marla Maples.

props.synopsis: Marla Maples reveals the role she played in bringing the US president and Robert F Kennedy Jr into a powerful political alliance.

title.children: She was married to Trump, now she's helping rewrite America's health system

image.altText: housing minister Clare O'Neil speaking at press conference with Prime Minister anthony albanese

props.synopsis: Labor has been given several policy options to expand on its housing agenda after Jim Chalmers acknowledged yesterday its signature target was not on track.

title.children: Support payment for renters on Treasury's housing options list

image.altText: A woman surrounded by other pro-independence demonstrators holds up a Kanak flag behind her back.

props.synopsis: Observers say regardless of the enthusiasm of French President Emmanuel Macron, the deal faces a long and uncertain path before it can take effect. So, how did it get to this point, and what needs to happen for it to take effect?

title.children: France has agreed to create a new 'state' near Australia. What does it mean?

image.altText: Two bitcoin tokens and a price chart behind them

props.synopsis: The original cryptocurrency has moved to the mainstream, with institutional investors and exchange traded funds helping build momentum. But some analysts remain sceptical about bitcoin's trajectory.

title.children: Bitcoin surges to fresh high but some warn 'it could get very ugly'

image.altText: Man with dark hair and a beard sits at a table and looks at his ipad.

props.synopsis: Jarod Graham says he is owed nearly $10,000 in unpaid superannuation from his former boss. He's not the only one.

title.children: Young workers falling victim to 'toxic work culture' and exploitation in huge numbers

image.altText: West Indies batter Mikyle Louis completes his swing as the cricket ball hits his stumps.

props.synopsis: Former West Indies captain Carl Hooper calls for heads to roll and World Cup hero Carlos Brathwaite labels the team "abysmal" after the team's record 3-0 loss to Australia.

title.children: Abysmal, unfair, angry and upset: Aussies leave West Indies cricket in tatters

image.altText: Australian journo stropped by Chinese security.

props.synopsis: Six journalists from Australian organisations — including the ABC — are stopped by local security guards despite having permission to film in Beijing's historic heart.

title.children: Australian journalists stopped by security on PM's China trip

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australian reporters stopped by Chinese security
Treasurer welcomes RBA move to end debit and credit card surcharges
Liberals to launch challenge over Bradfield election result

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: A rally on Wall Street has sent Australian stocks higher, while the Reserve Bank proposes an end to credit and debit card surcharges, which would save consumers and businesses $1.2 billion a year. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX rises after Wall Street gains on trade talks

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: China's economy loses momentum in second quarter
Consumer sentiment ticks up despite rate cut disappointment
Isn't it good to have a housing target?

image.altText: a long stretch of blue hallway in a sterile, brightly lit warehouse

props.synopsis: Documents show Greater Western Water is assessing 19 data centre applications requesting to use a total of 20 gigalitres of water annually — the same amount 330,000 Melburnians used in the last financial year.

title.children: Data centres bid to guzzle enough drinking water for 330,000 people

image.altText: An assortment of different police vehicles parked on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: WA Police Commissioner Col Blanch describes the death of a baby in a Balcatta home as a "family violence incident", as the child's mother remains under police guard in hospital.

title.children: Police treating death of baby in Perth's north as 'family violence incident'

image.altText: A man in a scarlet coat kneels on a jetty on the edge of a river with a grey swan in his arms, preparing to release it

props.synopsis: The River Thames transforms into a whirl of scarlet uniforms and wooden skiffs for King Charles III's annual swan census.

title.children: King Charles's annual swan census begins on River Thames

image.altText: Paul Kabai and Pabai Pabai

props.synopsis: In a landmark case, a judge will today decide whether Australia needs to make deeper emissions cuts to protect its low-lying islands. Two Torres Strait Islanders have sued the federal government for failing to protect their homes from the impacts of climate change.

title.children: 'Saving my people': Four-year landmark climate battle to be decided today

image.altText: A photo of Sesame Street character Elmo holding a card with a heart on it

props.synopsis: The account has more than 650,000 followers and is a reliable stream of wholesome content on a platform where inflammatory rhetoric and abusive messages thrive.

title.children: Hacker uses Elmo's X account to post antisemitic rant and demand release of Epstein files

image.altText: GettyImages-2224341657

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says the Club World Cup trophy remains in the Oval Office despite Chelsea winning the competition over the weekend.

title.children: Trump says he has real Club World Cup trophy and Chelsea given replica

image.altText: a couple sitting on a couch

props.synopsis: Some in the industry say the case highlights the need for more to be done to stop unlicensed contractors promising to complete small jobs.

title.children: A handyman was paid $8k for work he never did. Turns out he's in jail

image.altText: Wind turbines black and white.

props.synopsis: International energy companies are reconsidering their investments in Australian offshore wind projects as the Trump administration's disruption of the industry causes global uncertainty.

title.children: Energy giant drops offshore wind project amid global 'headwinds'

image.altText: Lena beams while standing in front of a pastel background with the title of her TV show Too Much on it, as she wears a red gown.

props.synopsis: The divisive creator behind the 2012 millennial satire is back making semi-autobiographical comedy. Do we finally understand her?

title.children: Lena Dunham is back with a new series. Here's why she's so divisive

image.altText: A close up of a mother holding her son who has his arms wrapped around her.

props.synopsis: A survey of nearly 400 women around Australia found a delay in diagnosing birth injuries is leading to more severe mental health issues.

title.children: A delay in diagnosing childbirth injuries is affecting women's mental health, survey finds

image.altText: American sprinter Noah Lyles dips over the finish line to win the men's 100m Olympic final, with a Jamaican runner behind him.

props.synopsis: With three years to go until the opening of the Los Angeles Olympics, organisers reveal the schedule that shows the tradition of swimming in week one and athletics in week two will be turned on its head.

title.children: LA Olympics breaks tradition by scheduling athletics in first week

image.altText: Large mounds of brown seaweed alongside pylons on a beach.

props.synopsis: The opening of Marion Bay's new $3.8 million boat ramp has been marred by a host of safety complaints, with key groups now refusing to use it.

title.children: Fishers and Sea Rescue refuse to use new $3.8m boat ramp

image.altText: Man in red jumper stands next to sign and in front of hotel

props.synopsis: Retired investment banker Ian Gillings threatens legal action against Blayney Shire Council over its plan to fix a dilapidated footpath outside his business in regional New South Wales.

title.children: Council and business owner's $60,000 battle over footpath

image.altText: A large sandstone block sits on red carpet with two iron rings imbedded in it

props.synopsis: Arnaud Harixcalde Logan appears in a Scottish court charged with "malicious mischief" after allegedly damaging the glass case holding the stone.

title.children: Kilt-clad man from Sydney arrested after allegedly smashing Stone of Scone case

image.altText: A police car parked out the front of a house cut off with police tape.

props.synopsis: A 57-year-old man was found dead in the front yard of his Warana home.

title.children: Police say stabbed man may have died day before body found

image.altText: A photo taken from above of a man in a dark shirt and cream pants sitting on another man who is lying on a footpath.

props.synopsis: Police investigate a knife threat at a restaurant in Melbourne's inner north-west while a man appears in court over an incident police allege involved mental health issues, not terrorism.

title.children: Two knife incidents within same hour in Moonee Ponds shopping strip

image.altText: A man in a chair after a fire

props.synopsis: Firefighters were met with heavy smoke and flames at the front of the building, with occupants trapped inside, officials said.

title.children: At least nine dead after fire at Massachusetts assisted living facility

image.altText: A young woman in an orange shirt on a river bank holding a large egg

props.synopsis: Lailani Johnson says it is thrilling to find clutches of endangered turtle eggs as part of a Queensland program connecting young people with country.

title.children: Nursing dream on hold as teen focuses on saving rare turtles

image.altText: A photo of a pangolin, with its tough scaly outer layer, arching its back at night in grass

props.synopsis: The ABC's beloved nature nerd, Dr Ann Jones, is on a mission to uncover the secret lives of some of the world's most elusive animals. Test yourself — or learn a thing or two — about these intriguing creatures.

title.children: Is a pangolin a mammal or reptile? Take our secretive animals quiz to find out
